intro: Ecbolium neuranthum, commonly known as the false milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a fuzzy texture and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky substance. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Ecbolium neuranthum is adapted to withstand drought conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
